e5e2f715-50b6-4cfa-a468-664bdd0fd02d.description: Individuals who have earned this badge have participated in an interactive Credly Platform training session covering topics such as badge metadata, analytics, and labor market insights. Earners understand the value and benefits of digital badging and how to leverage Credly's best practices to develop a meaningful digital badging program. These individuals are capable of navigating the Acclaim platform and using the available features to offer digital credentials from their organization.
e5e2f715-50b6-4cfa-a468-664bdd0fd02d.name: Credly Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Complete platform training with Credly Customer Success Manager.
Submit a working document of a credential prototype. To be reviewed by a panel of experts.

alignments.description: Open Badges started as a collaborative project between MacArthur Foundation, HASTAC and Mozilla and has continued to grow through an open, collaborative approach. IMS Global is now the community consortia establishing industry best and next practices.

This information may also be shared as an endorsement and thus display more prominently when the earner generates a transcript from their Credly dashboard.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in an interactive Credly platform demonstration, hosted by the Credly Customer Success team or the Partnership Management team.
Have assessed the Credly platform and services relative to their organization's needs and evaluated how a digital credential strategy will complement or enable the organization's goals.

alignments.name: IMS Open Badge Standard
alignments.description: Open Badges started as a collaborative project between MacArthur Foundation, HASTAC and Mozilla and has continued to grow through an open, collaborative approach.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a sequence of courses that covers the foundations of data collection, data ingestion, data analysis of large data sets, data model building, and data visualization techniques in an applied business context.
Pass the end-of-course exams with at least 80% score.
Complete the end-of-pathway integrative project to demonstrate applied skills in a business setting.
